title: When you have to return to lane after feeding Jax

replies.body: Feeding any of the meta toplaners more like :P

Eh some of them will mostly just bully you off of CS. Most top laners once they get ahead they force you to play ultra passive and miss out on most your farm. But Jax just straight up dives you if you dare to get anywhere close. He is snowbally, even by meta top laner standards (which is saying something)

> [{quoted}](name=Laughing Fish,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=IvJUjK9f,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-03-25T21:49:33.790+0000)
>
> Eh some of them will mostly just bully you off of CS. Most top laners once they get ahead they force you to play ultra passive and miss out on most your farm. But Jax just straight up dives you if you dare to get anywhere close. He is snowbally, even by meta top laner standards (which is saying something)

Say that to Riven or Irelia when they're fed as well. Even Renekton can easily tower dive when fed as well as Aatrox.

I'll take a Jax over Riven any day of the week. At least Jax is actually vulnerable to poke and has just one mobility tool and telegraphed stun.

Oh certainly, there are a few that snowball as brutally as him. Aatrox especially (though I haven't seen a good one in awhile. Not sure if this is because of my elo or if he just sucks now) offers no way to play around him once he gets fed enough. Irelia isn't nearly as brutal when fed as she was before her nerfs. A lot of that has to due with that she feels pretty underpowered right now. That's not to say she doesn't snowball hard af (she does), but she isn't Jax levels of unforgiving anymore. 

So with Aatrox and Irelia no longer being as dangerous as they used to be, of the best top laners I'd say only Riven snowballs as hard as Jax, as like jax she has combination of mobility, defense, and high damage to dive you, kill you, and offer little counterplay once they have enough of a gold/xp lead.

###### Maybe Kayle too, but tbh I make a lot of mistakes vs her so that might be a personal problem that I'm just not used to her. So I'm not sure if she counts as Jax level of snowball or not
You ever seen what happens when Urgot, renekton, Camilie or Riven get fed? :P

He was certainly good. Of just the doctor in a vacuum, I really loved Peter Capaldi. However, the writing I felt was significantly weaker during his run then in Tennant's or Smith's. The writers certainly had their moments, (I think "Heaven Sent" is matched ONLY by "Blink" for best written Doctor Who Episode), but they were far from consistent. And the supporting characters were meh for his first two seasons, it wasn't until he got Bill and Nardole that he had a supporting cast that truly clicked with him. 

David Tennant was *almost* as good as Capaldi himself imo, but had far better supporting characters and writing, making his run the best.

I love the episode "Midnight" with David Tennant. Well, to be honest, I love a lot of 10th Doctor episodes.
I got into Doctor Who because of him. I watched a few of his episodes and then went back to watch "Series 2005" from the beggining.

> [{quoted}](name=Laughing Fish,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=IvJUjK9f,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-03-25T22:05:21.354+0000)
>
> He was certainly good. Of just the doctor in a vacuum, I really loved Peter Capaldi. However, the writing I felt was significantly weaker during his run then in Tennant's or Smith's. The writers certainly had their moments, (I think "Heaven Sent" is matched ONLY by "Blink" for best written Doctor Who Episode), but they were far from consistent. And the supporting characters were meh for his first two seasons, it wasn't until he got Bill and Nardole that he had a supporting cast that truly clicked with him. 
> 
> David Tennant was *almost* as good as Capaldi himself imo, but had far better supporting characters and writing, making his run the best.

Fair enough, I will admit that Tenant was not as charicateristically developed as Capaldi for sure. But Tenant captured the idealistic principles of the doctor perfectly and for that reason and a few others his episodes just feel the best to watch. Also, the writing went mostly to crap right before Smith's farewell and didn't really improve much since at least imo.
I've heard good things about Jodie, but I dont have time to watch her yet.
Will admit the episode right after "Face the raven" in the castle was probably the best in his run. I think that is "heaven sent" but it may be "hell bent" I'm not sure. His regeneration special wasn't bad either to be fair (still doesn't compare to vale decem tho :))

Yeah the episode after "Face the raven" is "Heaven Sent", which was his best episode and imo the best in the series. Capaldi's final season was *very* solid imo, with the majority of the episodes being great. Him, Bill, and Nardole were a great trio, and the writing was a lot more creative. The fact that 2/3 seasons though had sub-par writing puts him behind Tennant though. 

>  I will admit that Tenant was not as charicateristically developed as Capaldi for sure. But Tenant captured the idealistic principles of the doctor perfectly and for that reason and a few others his episodes just feel the best to watch.

Tennant's doctor was certainly the most well written. The thing is Capaldi I feel was simply the best actor to play the doctor, which added a lot more emotion. But Tennant was a more well rounded and interestingly written character. 


> I've heard good things about Jodie, but I dont have time to watch her yet.

She has potential. But that potential hasn't been realized yet, and things don't always land. But there is a new showrunner at the same time as a new doctor, so some mistakes are inevitable. I have high hopes for future seasons though.
I found the weakest writing to be Smith's era, really. Was overly confusing, and way too grand and high-stakes for me.

God damn it....today I finished that episode before starting the 5th season....

Only thing in mind are the daleks now...
WHY U BREAK MY HEARTH LIKE THIS!!!
I would say this fits {{champion:39}} better. Once she starts murdering you, there is no safe place.
